worklogs.comment:
jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #5906: ARROW-7261: [Python] Add Python support for Fixed Size List type
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5906
 
 
   https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7261
   
   The python sequence converter is not yet safe (I just used the plain list converter for now, so it doesn't check that all lists are of the same length). And conversion to python is also not yet implemented.

 @@ -1379,6 +1379,54 @@ cdef class LargeListArray(Array):
         return pyarrow_wrap_array(arr.values())
 
 
+cdef class FixedSizeListArray(Array):
+    """
+    Concrete class for Arrow arrays of a fixed size list data type.
+    """
+
+    @staticmethod
+    def from_arrays(values, int64_t length, MemoryPool pool=None):
+        """
+        Construct ListArray from arrays of int32 offsets and values
+
+        Parameters
+        ----------
+        offsets : Array (int32 type)
+        values : Array (any type)
+
+        Returns
+        -------
+        list_array : ListArray
+        """
+        cdef:
+            Array _values
+            shared_ptr[CArray] out
+
+        _values = asarray(values)
+
+        with nogil:
+            check_status(CFixedSizeListArray.FromArrays(
+                _values.sp_array, length, &out))
+        cdef Array result = pyarrow_wrap_array(out)
+        result.validate()
+        return result
+
+    @property
+    def values(self):
+        return self.flatten()
+
+    def flatten(self):
+        """
+        Unnest this ListArray by one level
 
 Review comment:
   ```suggestion
           Unnest this FixedSizeListArray by one level
   ```

emkornfield commented on pull request #5906: ARROW-7261: [Python] Add Python support for Fixed Size List type
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5906#discussion_r351113187
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/scalar.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -731,6 +731,57 @@ cdef class LargeListValue(ArrayValue):
         return result
 
 
+cdef class FixedSizeListValue(ArrayValue):
+    """
+    Concrete class for fixed size list array elements.
+    """
+
+    def __len__(self):
+        """
+        Return the number of values.
+        """
+        return self.length()
+
+    def __getitem__(self, i):
+        """
+        Return the value at the given index.
+        """
+        return self.getitem(_normalize_index(i, self.length()))
+
+    def __iter__(self):
+        """
+        Iterate over this element's values.
+        """
+        for i in range(len(self)):
+            yield self.getitem(i)
+        raise StopIteration
+
+    cdef void _set_array(self, const shared_ptr[CArray]& sp_array):
+        self.sp_array = sp_array
+        self.ap = <CFixedSizeListArray*> sp_array.get()
+        self.value_type = pyarrow_wrap_data_type(self.ap.value_type())
+
+    cdef getitem(self, int64_t i):
+        cdef int64_t j = self.ap.value_offset(self.index) + i
+        return box_scalar(self.value_type, self.ap.values(), j)
 
 Review comment:
   not familiar with what box_scalar does but it seems strange to be boxing a non-scalar type list?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #5906: ARROW-7261: [Python] Add Python support for Fixed Size List type
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5906#discussion_r351204791
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/scalar.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -731,6 +731,57 @@ cdef class LargeListValue(ArrayValue):
         return result
 
 
+cdef class FixedSizeListValue(ArrayValue):
+    """
+    Concrete class for fixed size list array elements.
+    """
+
+    def __len__(self):
+        """
+        Return the number of values.
+        """
+        return self.length()
+
+    def __getitem__(self, i):
+        """
+        Return the value at the given index.
+        """
+        return self.getitem(_normalize_index(i, self.length()))
+
+    def __iter__(self):
+        """
+        Iterate over this element's values.
+        """
+        for i in range(len(self)):
+            yield self.getitem(i)
+        raise StopIteration
+
+    cdef void _set_array(self, const shared_ptr[CArray]& sp_array):
+        self.sp_array = sp_array
+        self.ap = <CFixedSizeListArray*> sp_array.get()
+        self.value_type = pyarrow_wrap_data_type(self.ap.value_type())
+
+    cdef getitem(self, int64_t i):
+        cdef int64_t j = self.ap.value_offset(self.index) + i
+        return box_scalar(self.value_type, self.ap.values(), j)
 
 Review comment:
   > not familiar with what box_scalar does but it seems strange to be boxing a non-scalar type list?
   
   This is getting one element of the list value (not boxing the full list value), which typically is a scalar, unless you have nested lists (so `self` is a single list of the list array, and this method is then getting one element of that list)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

 File path: cpp/src/arrow/array.h
 ##########
 @@ -709,6 +709,14 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT FixedSizeListArray : public Array {
     return values_->Slice(value_offset(i), value_length(i));
   }
 
+  /// \brief Construct FixedSizeListArray from child value array and value_length
+  ///
+  /// \param[in] values Array containing list values
+  /// \param[in] list_size The fixed length of each list
+  /// \param[out] out Will have length equal to values.length() / list_size
+  static Status FromArrays(const std::shared_ptr<Array>& values, int32_t list_size,
 
 Review comment:
   Since we're discussing migrating public APIs to `Result<>`, this one should probably return a `Result<std::shared_ptr<Array>>`.

fields.description: I didn't see any issue about this, but {{FixedSizeListArray}} (ARROW-1280) is not yet exposed in Python.
fields.summary: [Python] Python support for fixed size list type
